oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Farm journal of Thomas H. Fowlkes relating to his slaves
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Journal includes entries on work and personal conduct rules for the Fowlkes slaves, an 1860 list of 40 slaves with information such as name, skin color, and price or value. Notes about which slaves were doing what kind of work; time taken off, e.g "Louisa; stopped when she went to suckle her child". Fowlkes' slave property was valued at $29,700 that year. The unusual list of rules for his slaves includes specific protocols for work, permission to leave farm, regimen for meals, care of animals & tools, etc.
